S3.T1.caption: TABLE I: Summary of poisoning attacks and countermeasures.
references:
We summarize the poisoning attacks and countermeasures in Table I. From the table, the existing countermeasures are designed to prevent the global model from aggregating poisoned model updates, by way of discarding or devaluing part of the received model updates.
For example, in KRUM, only the most representative model update can be used to update the global model, while the others are all dropped.
In this sense, the existing countermeasures under-utilize model updates.
